folder: Hudson Street & Charles Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hudson Street, west side, at Charles Street, showing at the S. W. corner, Meyer's Pharmacy. Note the early overhead sign board advertising Soverign Cigarettes.
Circa 1900
J. J. Corell, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection

folder: Perry Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY
text: Perry Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Greenwich Street. Nos. 132-134 Perry Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Greenwich Street, is the old Perry Street Methodist Episcopal Chapel. About 1915.

folder: Hudson Street & Charles Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Filling station on Hudson Street at the N.E. corner of Charles Street, on the site of 538-542 Hudson Street, which were demolished
around 1930.
March 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Charles Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Charles Street, south side, west from and including Hudson
Street.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr. Neg.#4726

folder: Hudson Street & Charles Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
533-327 Hudson Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Charles Street, and west on the south side of Charles Street.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hudson Street & Charles Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
535-543 Hudson Street, at, adjoining, and north of the N.W. corner of Charles Street, and west on the north side of Charles
Street.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 40; The Texas Rangers always get their man. 541 Hudson Street, on the west side, between Charles and Perry Streets.
November 30, 1933.
L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 41. At the grocery store on the N.W. corner of Hudson
and Perry Streets.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
No. 2. The same.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Greenwich Street & Perry Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
729 Greenwich Street, adjoining the S. E. corner of Perry Street. The archway shown leads to a center garden and from which the interior apartments are reached; there being several rear houses.
March 31, 1940
George D. Chinn

text:

Oct. 27, 1940
